page.title: 20 St. Peter's Church Newton
page.content: The first ever recorded date of the church was 1212. As you enter you see a font in front of you, it was made in the 14th C. and has 8 sides.The cover is a jagged cone. Some of the side windows have stained glass panels of figures and patterns. Some of this glass is amongst the oldest in the Midlands. One window shows two of the apostles. These were painted in about 1420. The main East window is more recent and was given by a woman in memory of her husband. There are six stone priests' seats at the side of the church near the altar table.There are also two brasses on the floor nearby. A screen erected in memory of those who died in the war, it divides the church into two parts. Nearly all the village are involved with the church in some way. About 30 people regularly attend services.
